But I believe we have a profound national interest to ensure that more than only 9 out of 100 kids born into poverty are able to obtain a college degree. Recognizing some important women in my life on #InternationalWomensDay:  My mother is one of the strongest people I’ve ever known. She survived the Holocaust as a young girl and came to the United States as an immigrant. She worked as a school librarian throughout my childhood. Without question, I would not be here were it not for her strength and wisdom.   I see those same values in my wife, Susan, whose dedication to teaching and the law inspires my entire family to work harder every day.   I also see my mother’s resilience in the eyes of my daughters, who are growing up in a society that too often dismisses them. But because of the community of women around them, they face those setbacks with hope for a future that can and will be brighter.  Thank you to every woman who has taught me how to stand up and protect the rights of all women.
